title: metadata -i key val PATH  prints out metadata for all files
body:
I expect it just to carry prescribed action -- initialize meta-data for the files under PATH... IMHO it should not look at any other path, not to mention print them all out.

```shell
(git-annex)hopa:/tmp/raiders[master]
$> git annex metadata qa        
metadata qa/defacing/alldefaced.nii.gz 

ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefaced_mean.nii.gz 

ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefacemasks.nii.gz 

ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefacemasks_mean.nii.gz 

ok
(dev) 2 10390.....................................:Thu 07 Sep 2017 01:35:39 PM EDT:.
(git-annex)hopa:/tmp/raiders[master]
$> datalad metadata -i key val qa       
/tmp/raiders/.datalad/config (file): key
/tmp/raiders/aligned/task002/BOLD/bold_hyper_sw1_mni_gray_large.hdf5.gz (file): key
/tmp/raiders/aligned/task002/BOLD/bold_hyper_sw1_mni_gray_large_part1_hyperaligned.hdf5.gz (file): key
/tmp/raiders/aligned/task002/BOLD/bold_hyper_sw1_mni_vt.hdf5.gz (file): key
..... tons of lines ...
```
at least it seems (I do not see that in result output above) accomplishes the mission:

```shell
$> datalad metadata  qa          
/tmp/raiders/qa/defacing/alldefaced.nii.gz (file): key
/tmp/raiders/qa/defacing/alldefaced_mean.nii.gz (file): key
/tmp/raiders/qa/defacing/alldefacemasks.nii.gz (file): key
/tmp/raiders/qa/defacing/alldefacemasks_mean.nii.gz (file): key

$> git annex metadata qa           
metadata qa/defacing/alldefaced.nii.gz 
  key=qa
  key=val
  key-lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
  lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefaced_mean.nii.gz 
  key=qa
  key=val
  key-lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
  lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefacemasks.nii.gz 
  key=qa
  key=val
  key-lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
  lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
ok
metadata qa/defacing/alldefacemasks_mean.nii.gz 
  key=qa
  key=val
  key-lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
  lastchanged=2017-09-07@17-35-54
ok
```

the same dump happens for `-a`
